channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Right turn stuck on red for single cars, 4th December
item.description:
Westbound from Gants Hill roundabout for right turn into Beehive Lane. Signal stays on red for single car unless another car is in right turn going in opposite direction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beehive Lane, Gants Hill, Greater London

item.title: Dead fox in the middle of the road, 4th December
item.description:
Was driving down merewood road barnehurst at around 1am and swerved to avoid the fox unfortunately deceased in the middle of the road. Not sure how long it had been there but looked like it had happened fairly recently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Merewood Road, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping near food waste bin, 3rd December
item.description:

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load (Estates)

item.title: 30cm Pothole, 3rd December
item.description:
There is a 30ish cm pothole, that is only getting bigger. This was previously a private road but has been adopted by the council. Feels like there is some neglect here. There are a few other smaller holes down the road. The one mentioned is of a particular problem due to the arrangement of parked cars. It forces drives to go over it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fox Hollow Drive, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No parking available due to a mix of commercial vans and non residents parking in the road, 3rd December
item.description:
On Thorpewood Avenue (SE26) we have a growing issue with commercial vans being left on the road for several days at a time without moving. Some vehicles remain parked for two to four days continuously. This is creating a number of problems for the street. Residents are finding it increasingly difficult to park near their homes because these long stay vans take up valuable space for extended periods. Large vans restrict visibility for children and families walking to and from school and make it harder for prams, pushchairs and wheelchairs to navigate the road safely. The size and positioning of the vans narrow the road, making passing traffic more difficult and sometimes forcing oncoming cars to reverse long distances. The street is effectively being used as a storage area for commercial vehicles that do not belong to residents, and this has become a daily issue. The current school related restrictions do not prevent these vans from occupying the street outside the restricted hours and the situation has noticeably worsened in recent months. We request that the council investigates this matter and considers introducing appropriate parking controls or reviewing the existing restrictions. This part of the road is increasingly being used for unmanaged long stay commercial parking, and it is having a serious impact on residents and on safety around school times. Photos can be provided if required. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Thorpewood Avenue, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Right, turn traffic lights stuck on red, 3rd December
item.description:
Sat in the right turn lane for what should’ve been three or four right turn light changes but the light stayed on red whilst all the surrounding lights went through their usual cycle. had to abandon the right turn and go straight on to use the roundabout further down to come back the opposite way to make the turn in the end as did several others
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
